question_content.barrons:question: The quotation marks around the word poetic serve to

barrons:choices.barrons:choice: indicate the word is being used in an ironic sense
point out the inspirational quality of this school of writing
imply that the historians involved wrote in verse.

question_content.barrons:explanation:
indicate the word is being used in an ironic sense.

The author of the passage has already indicated his dissatisfaction with the magic-loving, metaphor-using school of historical writing that obscures more than it illuminates. Clearly, he is using the word "poetic" in an ironic sense.

Emphasize the triteness of the term is incorrect. Nothing in the passage suggests that the term poetic is hackneyed or trite as a description of this school of historical writing.

Identify the use of a colloquialism is incorrect. Nothing in the passage suggests that the term poetic is a colloquialism or informal, conversational expression.

Point out the inspirational quality of this school of writing is incorrect. Nothing in this passage suggests that the author finds this school of writing particularly inspirational or moving.

Imply that the historians involved wrote in verse is incorrect. Nothing in the passage suggests that this school of historical writing ever produced anything in verse.
